definition: to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)

sentences.english: A lot of Chinese and foreign tourists to see the tree after hanging its amazing beauty repeatedly.
sentences.chinese: 很多中外游客看到树挂后都连声惊叹其美丽。

sentences.english: She smiled and said a thousand thanks.
He went by his teacher without even a greeting.
sentences.chinese: 他从老师身边经过时连声招呼也没打。

sentences.english: Jimmy coughed and choked on a piece of sausage.
sentences.chinese: 正吃着香肠的吉米听到这个消息被呛得连声咳嗽。

sentences.english: He babbled his thanks in a great hurry.
The boy kept yessing when his father was talking with him.
sentences.chinese: 那个男孩在他爸爸对他说话时连声说是。

sentences.english: Bird's repeatedly crow really brought me into the spring arms.
sentences.chinese: 它的连声啼鸣，确实把我带到了春天的怀抱。

sentences.english: A tour guide kept saying the same road like Asako.
sentences.chinese: 一位导游连声说路面简直像麻子一样。

sentences.english: I went into the dressing-room, opened the window and called several times to Prudence.
sentences.chinese: 我走进梳妆间，推开窗户连声呼唤普律当丝。

sentences.english: Once again the others thought for a while, and felt this was more reasonable. So they expressed assent yet another time.
sentences.chinese: 众人又思考了一会，更觉合理，又连声称是。

sentences.english: Once again the others thought for a while, and felt this was more reasonable.
sentences.chinese: 众人又思考了一会，更觉合理，又连声称是。

sentences.english: Among them a tourist guide repeatedly sorry, said the road is like pock.
sentences.chinese: 其中一位导游连声抱歉，说路面简直像麻子一样。

sentences.english: We proffered apologies and he soon softened.
sentences.chinese: 我们赶忙连声道歉，他的脸色很快就转阴为晴了。

definition: in a great rush/in a flurry
brows raised in delight, eyes laughing (idiom); beaming with joy/all smiles
